dji.sdk.api.Camera

Class DJIPhantom3AdvancedCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.DJIObject
      • dji.sdk.api.Camera.DJICamera
        • dji.sdk.api.Camera.DJIInspireCamera
          • dji.sdk.api.Camera.DJIPhantom3AdvancedCamera

  • public class DJIPhantom3AdvancedCamera
extends DJIInspireCamera

    DJI Phantom 3 Advanced Camera

    This class is designed for Phantom3 Advanced. For Phantom3 Advanced, the download pattern is quite different from the one of Inspire1 and Phantom3 Pro. Phantom3 Advanced uses the media list from the push information to download the files' information in the SDcard. In addition, since the camera is different from Inspire1 and Phantom3 Pro, several parameters could not be set. For example, 4K video could not be recorded by Phantom3 Advanced.
    You could use this class to modify the parameter settings of photos and recordings so that they could satisfy your requirements. For example, if you want to adjust the size of photo you take, setCameraPhotoSize may help you to do that. With the help of the predefined enums, you could directly set up the parameters.
    Version:
    : V2.0.1
    Author:
    : DJI Software

    • Method Detail

      • initDownloadMode

        public void initDownloadMode(DJIExecuteResultCallback mCallback)
        This method will be used to initialize the new playback download mode. After invoking this method the camera mode will be shift to NEW_PLAYBACK_MODE directly and the developer could fetch the media list and then the media thumbnail, full screen thumbnail and of course the full resolution image or video.

        Post Condition:
        After this function invoked, the camera mode will shift to new playback mode.
        Overrides:
        initDownloadMode in class DJIInspireCamera
        Parameters:
        mCallback - - This will provide the execution result for this method.

      • stopDownloading

        public void stopDownloading()
        This will entirely stop the downloading process and of course clean the downloading thread pool.

        Precondition:
        Developers have started the downloading process first.

        Post Condition:
        After this function invoked, the camera mode will shift to new playback mode.
        Overrides:
        stopDownloading in class DJIInspireCamera

      • destory

        public void destory()
        Release Phantom 3 Advanced Camera
        Overrides:
        destory in class DJICamera

      • continueDownloading

        public void continueDownloading()
        Continue Downloading. SDK provides a single thread pool to handle the download process. This api will be continue the download process and continue to download in the undo executed list.

        Precondition:
        Developer invoke the function of CancelDownloading().

        Post Condition:
        After this function invoked, the thread pool will continue to execute the download request.
        Overrides:
        continueDownloading in class DJIInspireCamera

      • pauseDownloading

        public void pauseDownloading()
        Shut down the downloading process immediately. This method will shut down the download process BUT it will not entirely stop the downloading process. Once the developer invokes ContinueDownloading the process will continue.

        Precondition:
        The camera is fetching data back to the sdk.

        Post Condition:
        After this function invoked, the downloading process will shut down temporarily.
        Overrides:
        pauseDownloading in class DJIInspireCamera

      • fetchMediaList

        public void fetchMediaList(DJIDownloadListener<DJIMediaDirInfo> mCall)
        The api will asyn request the file list from the SDcard. Developer could scan the media list and delete or download the file they want.

        Precondition : The camera Mode is in New playback mode.

        Post Condition : This method will request the media list which will reflect the content in the SD card. The content will be videos and images.
        Overrides:
        fetchMediaList in class DJIInspireCamera
        Parameters:
        mCall - - The media fetch callBack require the developer to implement five method. The details of this callback coudl be

        onStart() which will be called once the download process start.
        onRateUpdate() which will be called whenever the downloading percentage updates.
        onProgress() which will be called whenever the downloading
        onSuccess() which will be called once the download is finished.
        onFailure() which will be called once an error occurs.
        See Also:
        dji.sdk.api.Camera.DJIP3AMediaDirInfo, dji.sdk.interface.DJIP3ADownloadListener

      • fetchMediaThumbnail

        public void fetchMediaThumbnail(java.io.File destDir,
                                DJIMediaInfo mDjiMedia,
                                DJIDownloadListener<DJIMediaFile> mCall)
        The method will download the media thumbnail. This method could be used to cache the icon for each media in the SDcard.

        Precondition:
        The camera Mode is in New playback mode.

        Post Condition:
        This method will start to download the media thumbnail in the SD card. The content could be videos and images.
        Overrides:
        fetchMediaThumbnail in class DJIInspireCamera
        Parameters:
        mCall - - The media fetch callBack require the developer to implement five method. The details of this callback coudl be

        onStart() which will be called once the download process start.
        onRateUpdate() which will be called whenever the downloading percentage updates.
        onProgress() which will be called whenever the downloading
        onSuccess() which will be called once the download is finished.
        onFailure() which will be called once an error occurs.
        mDjiMedia - - This instance contains the information which is needed to download the thumbnail.
        destDir - - This is a file instance for identify the location where the file will be put.
        See Also:
        dji.sdk.api.Camera.DJIMediaFile, dji.sdk.api.Camera.DJIP3AMediaInfo, dji.sdk.interface.DJIP3ADownloadListener

      • fetchMediaPreviewImage

        public void fetchMediaPreviewImage(java.io.File destDir,
                                   DJIMediaInfo mDjiMedia,
                                   DJIDownloadListener<DJIMediaFile> mCall)
        The method will start to download a full screen thumbnail, whose resolution is 960 x 540.

        Precondition:
        The camera Mode is in New playback mode.

        Post Condition:
        This method will start to download the media full screen thumbnail in the SD card. The content could be videos and images.
        Overrides:
        fetchMediaPreviewImage in class DJIInspireCamera
        Parameters:
        mCall - - The media fetch callBack require the developer to implement five method. The details of this callback coudl be

        onStart() which will be called once the download process start.
        onRateUpdate() which will be called whenever the downloading percentage updates.
        onProgress() which will be called whenever the downloading
        onSuccess() which will be called once the download is finished.
        onFailure() which will be called once an error occurs.
        mDjiMedia - - This instance contains the information which is needed to download the full screen thumbnail.
        destDir - - This is a file instance for identify the location where the file will be put.
        See Also:
        dji.sdk.api.Camera.DJIMediaFile, dji.sdk.api.Camera.DJIP3AMediaInfo, dji.sdk.interface.DJIP3ADownloadListener

      • fetchMediaData

        public void fetchMediaData(java.io.File destDir,
                           DJIMediaInfo mDjiMedia,
                           DJIDownloadListener<DJIMediaFile> mCall)
        The method will start to download an original file from the SDcard.

        Precondition:
        The camera Mode is in New playback mode.

        Post Condition:
        This method will start to download the media orginal file in the SD card. The content could be videos and images.
        Overrides:
        fetchMediaData in class DJIInspireCamera
        Parameters:
        mCall - - The media fetch callBack, which is an interface instance, requires the developer to implement five methods. The details of this callback are as follow:

        onStart() which will be called once the download process start.
        onRateUpdate() which will be called whenever the downloading percentage updates.
        onProgress() which will be called whenever the downloading
        onSuccess() which will be called once the download is finished.
        onFailure() which will be called once an error occurs.
        mDjiMedia - - This instance contains the information which is needed to download the original file.
        destDir - - This is a file instance for identify the location where the file will be put.
        See Also:
        dji.sdk.api.Camera.DJIMediaFile, dji.sdk.api.Camera.DJIP3AMediaInfo, dji.sdk.interface.DJIP3ADownloadListener

      • deleteMedias

        public void deleteMedias(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexs,
                         DJIDeleteFileCallBack mCallBack)
        The method will delete all the file with the index which is contained in the indexs arraylist.

        Precondition:
        The camera Mode is in New playback mode.

        Post Condition:
        This method will delete the media files based on the indexs.
        Overrides:
        deleteMedias in class DJIInspireCamera
        Parameters:
        mCall - - This callback will return an arraylist which will contain the undeleted files' index and a DJIError for notificating the developers whether the method has been executed successfully.
        indexs - - This arraylist will contain the indexs which developers want to delete.
